programme.title: 2023 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.sub-title: First Round: West Virginia vs. Arizona
programme.desc: The No. 7 Wildcats meet the No. 10 Mountaineers in an NCAA Tournament first-round game. Arizona was a 2021 national finalist. West Virginia had a three-game win streak snapped by Oklahoma State on a buzzer-beater in the Big 12 quarterfinals.

programme.title: 2023 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.sub-title: First Round: Norfolk State vs. South Carolina
programme.desc: The No. 1 Gamecocks face the No. 16 Spartans in the NCAA Tournament's first round. South Carolina won its seventh SEC banner, and third in four years, by beating Tennessee on March 5. Norfolk State joins the Big Dance for the first time since 2002.

programme.title: 2023 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.sub-title: First Round: Southeastern Louisiana vs. Iowa
programme.desc: Caitlin Clark and the No. 2 Hawkeyes match up with the No. 15 Lions in the NCAA Tournament's round of 64. Southeastern Louisiana dances for the first time after standing atop the Southland Conference. Iowa won a third Big Ten title in five years.

programme.title: 2023 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.sub-title: First Four: St. John's vs. Purdue
programme.desc: The Boilermakers play the Red Storm in an NCAA Tournament First Four game involving No. 11 seeds. Purdue, the 1999 national champion, appears in the field for the first time since 2017. The winner plays No. 6 North Carolina in the first round.

programme.title: 2023 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.sub-title: First Four: Monmouth vs. Tennessee Tech
programme.desc: The No. 16 Hawks face the No. 16 Golden Eagles in an NCAA Tournament First Four showdown. Monmouth upset top-seeded Towson to capture the Colonial Athletic Association championship. Tennessee Tech won a record 10th Ohio Valley Conference title.

programme.title: Keyshawn, JWill and Max

programme.title: Daily Wager
programme.desc: Doug Kezirian joins sports betting experts as well as ESPN analysts and reporters from various sports for discussion centered on analytics and point spreads as well as how the day's sports news affects betting.

programme.title: 2023 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.sub-title: First Round: Marquette vs. South Florida
programme.desc: The No. 9 Golden Eagles play the No. 8 Bulls in the NCAA Tournament's round of 64. South Florida, the regular-season American Athletic Conference champion, makes a third straight tourney appearance. Marquette lost to Big East champ UConn on March 5.

programme.title: 2023 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.sub-title: First Round: Georgia vs. Florida State
programme.desc: No. 7 Florida State and No. 10 Georgia line up for an NCAA Tournament first-round game. Seminoles freshman Ta'Niya Latson paced the ACC with 21.3 points per game. The Lady Bulldogs reached the tournament for the 36th time in their 42-year history.

programme.title: 2023 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.sub-title: First Round: Southern Utah vs. Notre Dame
programme.desc: The No. 3 Fighting Irish face the No. 14 Thunderbirds in the NCAA Tournament's first round. Notre Dame, the 2018 national champion, reached the ACC semifinals. Southern Utah makes its first NCAA trip after winning the Western Athletic Conference.

programme.title: 2023 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 3 Tigers (28-2) tangle with the No. 14 Rainbow Wahine (18-14) in the NCAA Tournament's round of 64. LSU started the season 23-0 before losing to No. 1 overall NCAA seed South Carolina. Hawaii has won two consecutive Big West titles.

programme.title: 2023 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 16 Pioneers look for the big upset of the No. 1 Cardinal in the NCAA Tournament's first round. Sacred Heart's Ny'Ceara Pryor was two rebounds shy of a triple-double in a First Four win over Southern. Stanford has lost two of its last three.

programme.title: On This Day
programme.sub-title: 2007: Portland Trail Blazers vs. Los Angeles Lakers
programme.desc: Kobe Bryant scores 24 of his 65 points in the fourth quarter and adds 9 in overtime powering the Lakers to a 116-111 victory. Bryant shoots 23-for-39 from the field 8-for-12 from 3-pt range and 11-for-12 from the free-throw line. From March 16, 2007.
